tag_list: philanthropy, giving, social-entrepreneur, citizen-philanthropy, prophet, tomorrow-ventures, eric-schmidt, branding, innovation
overview:
Dan Morrison is the CEO and Founder of Citizen Effect, a technology and human platform that empowers citizens to be philanthropists for small but critical projects.

Dan founded Citizen Effect in 2008 under the name 1Well. The name changed in 2009 after a social investment by Eric Schmidt and Tomorrow Ventures.

Prior to Citizen Effect, Dan was a Middle East consultant in Washington, DC. From 1997 to 2004, Dan was a innovation and brand strategy consultant with Prophet and Kuczmarski & Associates, and spent 2002-2004 in Japan opening Prophet’s Tokyo office.

Dan has a history degree from the University of Notre Dame and a Masters Degree in Middle Eastern Studies from the University of Chicago.
